content.description: Follow the lower 1/2 of this crack, which is set in a shallow corner and involves some a series of short cruxy moves separated by rest stances. Small stoppers offer less-than-ideal pro, be careful. Once beneath the bulging upper hand crack, sink in a good #3 camalot and skirt right onto the arete. Follow this for several more cruxy spots to a small ledge. Clip a bolt and crimp up chert past some suspect blocks to the top. An engaging climb that involves much cerebral maneuvering with some questionable pro.
content.protection:
Small cams to #.75

Small/medium stoppers

3 bolts

Chain anchor
content.location: The striking crack on the up-canyon end of the uphill face. The upper portion of the crack has yet to be scaled, but would probably require some trundling to be a safe option.

content.description: Changing of the Guard is an intimidating direct hand/finger crack on the back side of the Sentry. All day shade makes this a nice option to get out of the sun and pull on some steep rock. The protection is bomber and the climbing powerful, well worth the hike for a challenge in the shade.
content.protection: 1 bolt, single set of stoppers, and single set of cams to #3 C4. Double shoulder length runner if you plan on top roping as the route anchor is the summit anchor and needs to be extended to prevent a stuck rope.
content.location: Same start as The Night Shift, but instead of traversing right around the arete, continue direct up the crack through hands, fingers, and jugs to the summit.
